message.content:
=SUBSTITUTE(A1,'''','')

This formula uses the SUBSTITUTE function to replace all instances of a single quote (''') with an empty string (''). The A1 reference specifies that the formula should be applied to cell A1. You can copy and paste this formula into any other cell where you want to remove single quotes from the contents of another cell.

Note: If there are multiple consecutive single quotes in the source cell, they will be replaced with a single empty string, resulting in a loss of formatting. If you need to preserve the number of single quotes, you can use the REPLACE function instead:
=REPLACE(A1,'''','')
